message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SY 

The paper deals with the design of artificial agents that act towards specified goals in partially observed environments, which is a central task of artificial intelligence. It focuses on sequential game-theoretic models such as extensive-form games or some of their succinct representations such as multi-agent influence diagrams. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.GT (Computer Science - Game Theory). The paper also proposes a sampling-based approach that relies on algorithms analogous to AdaBoost and Markov chain Monte Carlo sampling, which are commonly used in machine learning and data science. Therefore, it is also likely to belong to cs.AI (Computer Science - Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Computer Science - Learning). The paper also deals with the computational aspects of the proposed approach, which involves the use of algorithms for optimization and sampling. Therefore, it is also likely to belong to cs.DS (Computer Science - Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper deals with the interaction over time with other agents with their own goals, which involves the use of control theory and optimization. Therefore, it is also likely to belong to cs.SY (Computer Science - Systems and Control).
